The claim is based on the presence of: Human Coronavirus" mentioned on the label of Lysol disinfectant spray, which has been on the market since 1962.
The Centers for Disease Control and Prev: CDC) clarifies that the novel coronavirus causing COVID-19 is not the same as the coronaviruses that commonly circulate among humans and cause mild illness.
The US Environmental Protection Agency: EPA) has approved two Lysol products as effective in killing SARS-CoV-2, the virus responsible for COVID-19, based on laboratory testing.
The manufacturer of Lysol: Reckitt Benckiser, confirms that the mention of "human coronavirus" on their labels refers to the family of coronaviruses in general, and not specifically to SARS-CoV-2. They also cite a published assessment confirming the effectiveness of their products against COVID-19.
